newsitem.title: USA: IADB, Japan sign cofinancing package for Mexico.
newsitem.headline: IADB, Japan sign cofinancing package for Mexico.

text.p: The Inter-American Development Bank (IADB) and Japan's Overseas Economic Cooperation Fund (OECF) on Tuesday signed a $755 million cofinancing package to help improve sanitation in Mexico City and Mexico's Mezquital valleys, the IADB said.
The IADB is providing $365 million for the project, while the OECF is providing an untied concessional loan of 45.1 billion yen, or about $390 million.
Local counterpart funds for the project total $260 million, the IADB said.
The project will improve the quality of water for about 18 million people, prevent potentially catastrophic floods, curb environmental degradation and reduce the incidence of waterborne diseases.

It will be coordinated by Mexico's National Water Commission, between the federal government, the Mexico City federal district, the State of Mexico and 18 regional municipalities of the Mexico Valley metropolitan area.
